verses.text: In his \w days|strong="H3117"\w* \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* came \w up|strong="H5927"\w*, and \w Jehoiakim|strong="H3079"\w* became his \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w*: then he \w turned|strong="H7725"\w* and \w rebelled|strong="H4775"\w* against him.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* against him \w bands|strong="H1416"\w* of the \w Chaldees|strong="H3778"\w*, and \w bands|strong="H1416"\w* of the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w*, and \w bands|strong="H1416"\w* of the \w Moabites|strong="H4124"\w*, and \w bands|strong="H1416"\w* of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w*, and \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* them against \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* to \w destroy|strong="H0006"\w* it, according to the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, which he \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* \w by|strong="H3027"\w* his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* the \w prophets|strong="H5030"\w*.  +  r 24.2  t by: Heb. by the hand of *

Surely at the \w commandment|strong="H6310"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came \add this\add* upon \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, to \w remove|strong="H5493"\w* \add them\add* out of his \w sight|strong="H6440"\w*, for the \w sins|strong="H2403"\w* of \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w*, according to all that he \w did|strong="H6213"\w*;

And also for the \w innocent|strong="H5355"\w* \w blood|strong="H1818"\w* that he \w shed|strong="H8210"\w*: for he \w filled|strong="H4390"\w* \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* with \w innocent|strong="H5355"\w* \w blood|strong="H1818"\w*; which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w would|strong="H0014"\w* not \w pardon|strong="H5545"\w*.

¶ Now the \w rest|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w acts|strong="H1697"\w* of \w Jehoiakim|strong="H3079"\w*, and all that he \w did|strong="H6213"\w*, \add are\add* they not \w written|strong="H3789"\w* in the \w book|strong="H5612"\w* of the \w chronicles|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*?

So \w Jehoiakim|strong="H3079"\w* \w slept|strong="H7901"\w* with his \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*: and \w Jehoiachin|strong="H3078"\w* his \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* in his stead.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w* \w came|strong="H3318"\w* not \w again|strong="H3254"\w* any more out of his \w land|strong="H0776"\w*: for the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* had \w taken|strong="H3947"\w* from the \w river|strong="H5158"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w* unto the \w river|strong="H5104"\w* \w Euphrates|strong="H6578"\w* all that pertained to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*.

¶ \w Jehoiachin|strong="H3078"\w* \add was\add* \w eighteen|strong="H8083"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H1121"\w* when he began to \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*, and he \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w months|strong="H2320"\w*. And his \w mother’s|strong="H0517"\w* \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add was\add* \w Nehushta|strong="H5179"\w*, the \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Elnathan|strong="H0494"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.\f + \fr 24.8 \ft Jehoiachin: also called Jeconiah and Coniah\f*

And he \w did|strong="H6213"\w* \add that which was\add* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to all that his \w father|strong="H0001"\w* had \w done|strong="H6213"\w*.

¶ At that \w time|strong="H6256"\w* the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* came \w up|strong="H5927"\w* against \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* was \w besieged|strong="H0935"\w*.\f + \fr 24.10 \ft was…: Heb. came into siege\f*

And \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* against the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* did \w besiege|strong="H6696"\w* it.

And \w Jehoiachin|strong="H3078"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, he, and his \w mother|strong="H0517"\w*, and his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, and his \w princes|strong="H8269"\w*, and his \w officers|strong="H5631"\w*: and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* him in the \w eighth|strong="H8083"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of his \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*.\f + \fr 24.12 \ft officers: or, eunuchs\f*\f + \fr 24.12 \ft his reign: Nebuchadnezzar’s eighth year\f*

And he carried \w out|strong="H3318"\w* thence all the \w treasures|strong="H0214"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the \w treasures|strong="H0214"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and cut in \w pieces|strong="H7112"\w* all the \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* which \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* had \w made|strong="H6213"\w* in the \w temple|strong="H1964"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, as the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had \w said|strong="H1696"\w*.

And he carried \w away|strong="H1540"\w* all \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and all the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w*, and all the mighty \w men|strong="H1368"\w* of \w valour|strong="H2428"\w*, \add even\add* \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w captives|strong="H1540"\w*, and all the \w craftsmen|strong="H2796"\w* and \w smiths|strong="H4525"\w*: none \w remained|strong="H7604"\w*, \w save|strong="H2108"\w* the poorest \w sort|strong="H1803"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*.

And he carried \w away|strong="H1540"\w* \w Jehoiachin|strong="H3078"\w* to \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, and the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w mother|strong="H0517"\w*, and the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w wives|strong="H0802"\w*, and his \w officers|strong="H5631"\w*, and the \w mighty|strong="H0352"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, \add those\add* \w carried|strong="H3212"\w* he into \w captivity|strong="H1473"\w* from \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* to \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*.\f + \fr 24.15 \ft officers: or, eunuchs\f*

And all the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w might|strong="H2428"\w*, \add even\add* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w*, and \w craftsmen|strong="H2796"\w* and \w smiths|strong="H4525"\w* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w*, all \add that were\add* \w strong|strong="H1368"\w* \add and\add* \w apt|strong="H6213"\w* for \w war|strong="H4421"\w*, even them the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* \w captive|strong="H1473"\w* to \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*.

¶ And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* made \w Mattaniah|strong="H4983"\w* his \w father’s brother|strong="H1730"\w* \w king|strong="H4427"\w* in his stead, and \w changed|strong="H5437"\w* his \w name|strong="H8034"\w* to \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w*.

\w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w* \add was\add* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w old|strong="H1121"\w* when he began to \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*, and he \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* \w eleven|strong="H0259"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*. And his \w mother’s|strong="H0517"\w* \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add was\add* \w Hamutal|strong="H2537"\w*, the \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Jeremiah|strong="H3414"\w* of \w Libnah|strong="H3841"\w*.

And he \w did|strong="H6213"\w* \add that which was\add* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to all that \w Jehoiakim|strong="H3079"\w* had \w done|strong="H6213"\w*.

For through the \w anger|strong="H0639"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* it came to pass in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* and \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, until he had cast them \w out|strong="H7993"\w* from his \w presence|strong="H6440"\w*, that \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w* \w rebelled|strong="H4775"\w* against the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*.
